overview: Jacob Ziemann joined Glynn Capital in 2010 and focuses primarily on the firm’s investment portfolio in public companies. He is responsible for company analysis, due diligence, and identifying new investment opportunities. He also assists the team on private investments. From 2008-2010, Jacob was an analyst in the Investment Banking Division of Morgan Stanley working in the Financial Sponsors Group in San Francisco. At Morgan Stanley, he worked with global private equity firms on front-end buyouts, add-ons, distressed asset purchases, and portfolio company exits across numerous industries. Jacob also spent two summers working in Prime Brokerage Sales and one summer working in Financial Sponsors at Morgan Stanley. Jacob studied abroad at Oxford’s University College reading Jurisprudence and attended Dartmouth’s Tuck Business School Business Bridge Program. He received a BA in Economics, Philosophy, and Politics from Pomona College in 2008.
